feed.subtitle: A simple, whitespace theme for academics. Based on [*folio](https://github.com/bogoli/-folio) design.

entry.title: My First Publication
entry.content:
My first paper as a co-author, “Synergistic Effects of Entropy Tuning in Niobium-Based Oxide Anode for Fast-Charging Lithium-Ion Batteries”, has been published in Advanced Functional Materials. This work was led by my research mentor Yoojin at Georgia Tech.

While pursuing my own project on cathode materials, I contributed to this work by preparing some of the electrode samples for electrochemical characterization and assisting with the final proofreading of the manuscript.

I’m truly excited about this achievement, and would like to thank Yoojin and all the co-authors for their great collaboration.

The full paper can be found under “Publications” tab.
entry.summary: My first paper as a co-author, “Synergistic Effects of Entropy Tuning in Niobium-Based Oxide Anode for Fast-Charging Lithium-Ion Batteries”, has been published in Advanced Functional Materials. This work was led by my research mentor Yoojin at Georgia Tech.

entry.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant at Prof. Nam-Soon Choi’s lab at KAIST

link.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant at Prof. Nam-Soon Choi’s lab at KAIST

entry.content: Returning to my home university, I started a new position as an undergraduate research assistant in Energy Materials Lab (PI: Prof. Nam-Soon Choi) at KAIST. I will focus on studying electrolyte additives suitable for Na-ion batteries under low-temperature condition. I’m excited to delve into this new system and look forward to making meaningful contributions.
entry.summary: Returning to my home university, I started a new position as an undergraduate research assistant in Energy Materials Lab (PI: Prof. Nam-Soon Choi) at KAIST. I will focus on studying electrolyte additives suitable for Na-ion batteries under low-temperature condition. I’m excited to delve into this new system and look forward to making meaningful contributions.

entry.title: Georgia Tech 19th UROP Spring Symposium
entry.content: I successfully presented my ongoing research at the 19th UROP Spring Symposium, held at the Exhibition Hall at Georgia Tech. Building on the lessons learned from my previous MRS poster session, I was able to deliver a more refined and effective presentation.
entry.summary: I successfully presented my ongoing research at the 19th UROP Spring Symposium, held at the Exhibition Hall at Georgia Tech. Building on the lessons learned from my previous MRS poster session, I was able to deliver a more refined and effective presentation.

entry.title: Georgia Tech 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition

link.title: Georgia Tech 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition

entry.content:
I gave a poster presentation at the 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition, organized by the MRS Chapter at Georgia Tech and held at the Marcus Nanotechnology Building.

As an undergraduate researcher, I presented my ongoing work on investigating the effect of surface treatment on Ni/Mn-based Co-free layered oxide cathode for Li-ion Batteries. You can find the poster in the “Projects” section of this website.

This was my very first poster presentation. The whole processes of desiging the poster, preparing a short pitch, and answering questions from the audience helped me further develop my scientific comuunication skills. It was truly a fantastic experience.

I’d like to give a special shout-out to my mentor Yoojin and my advisor Prof. Meilin Liu for their invaluable advice and support.
entry.summary: I gave a poster presentation at the 12th Annual MRS Poster Competition, organized by the MRS Chapter at Georgia Tech and held at the Marcus Nanotechnology Building.

entry.title: Exchange semester at Georgia Institute of Technology

link.title: Exchange semester at Georgia Institute of Technology

entry.content:
Right after getting discharged from my service duty, I’m starting new chapter of my academic journey at Georgia Institute of Technology.

At Georgia Tech, I will be joining Prof. Meilin Liu’s research group as an undergraduate researcher, where I will be focusing on studying electrode materials for Lithium-ion batteries. In addition, I will be taking relevant courseworks, such as Electrochemical Energy Storage and Conversion, to fulfil my degree requirements at KAIST.

I’m also honored to be a recipient of KOR-US High-Tech Industry Student Exchange Scholarship. This scholarship provides significant financial support of 9,000 USD and invaluable opportunities to visit leading research facilities across the U.S.
entry.summary: Right after getting discharged from my service duty, I’m starting new chapter of my academic journey at Georgia Institute of Technology.

entry.title: Excellent Social Service Personnel Award
entry.content:
I’m honored to be a receipient of “10th Excellent Social Service Personnel Award” (제10회 사회복무대상) from the Korea Military Manpower Administration.

Since November 2022, I have been serving as a Social Service Personnel at the Muan Social Welfare Center as an alternative to mandatory military service.

I was recommended by my supervisor for my diligent attitude during the service, as well as for my contributions to improving the center’s facilities and my strong client service skills.

This news was also featured in a local newspaper.
entry.summary: I’m honored to be a receipient of “10th Excellent Social Service Personnel Award” (제10회 사회복무대상) from the Korea Military Manpower Administration.

entry.title: KPF Academic Conference Best Study Award

link.title: KPF Academic Conference Best Study Award

entry.content:
I won third prize out of 26 teams in the Best Study Award at the KPF Academic Conference!

I submitted the work from my URP (KAIST Undergraduate Research Program) project last year, “Developing an Electrolytic Zn-Mn Battery System and Identifying Key Operating Conditions.” The full report can be found in the “Projects” section of this website.

I’m grateful to my mentor Kyungjae and my advisor Prof. Hee-Tak Kim for their support.
entry.summary: I won third prize out of 26 teams in the Best Study Award at the KPF Academic Conference!
